At Fri, 28 Dec 2007 09:23:00 -0800 (PST),
Mathew Nik Foscarini <nfoscarini@...> wrote:
> Sorry for all the spelling mistakes :(
>
> Kind of tired today.
>
> Mathew Nik Foscarini <nfoscarini@...> wrote:                               Hi,
>
> Have you tried using JDK 1.5, because that works fine for me.
>
> If I tried to compile my models with the Heritrix 1.12 binaries, then it complains that they were version 49 class files. Which means that 1.12 was compiled with JDK 1.5
>
> In order for it to run under JDK 1.4 they class files would have to be version 48.
>
> I can't find anything one their website that tells which version of the JDK is recommended for 1.12?
>
> I do know that I have problems compile Heritrix under JDK 1.5, and this confuses me, but my own modules compiled under JDK 1.5 work just fine.

Hi.

(I’m not entirely sure who I’m responding to here; the quoting is all
messed up.)

First, don’t use gcj. It never works with Java code that hasn’t been
made to work with it. If you need to use a GPL Java just wait a little
bit, or see if some of the new openjava stuff works. Otherwise
download & use Sun’s JDK 1.6.

Second, don’t use Fedora/Ubuntu/Debian packaged Java. Generally it’s
going to be more trouble than it is worth. Download JDK 1.6 from Sun’s
site, unpack it, & install in /opt. Make sure you set JAVA_HOME to be
equal to /opt/jdk (or wherever your JDK is installed).

Third, don’t compile Heritrix. There is no benefit to this (unless you
are modifying the Heritrix source).

Hope that helps. Good luck.

best,
Erik Hetzner
;; Erik Hetzner, California Digital Library
;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
